AddLegendMark(LegendIcon, LegendColor, String, DateTime, String, Boolean, Int32, Boolean, Boolean)

Add a legend mark to a player's legend.

Declaration
public bool AddLegendMark(LegendIcon icon, LegendColor color, string text, DateTime timestamp, string prefix = null, bool isPublic = true, int quantity = 0, bool displaySeason = true, bool displayTimestamp = true)
Parameters
Type Name Description
LegendIcon icon

The icon to be used for the mark (heart, sword, etc)
LegendColor color

The color the mark will be rendered in (blue, yellow, orange, etc)
System.String text

The actual text of the legend mark.
DateTime timestamp

The Terran time the legend was awarded.
System.String prefix

An invisible key (stored in the beginning of the mark) that can be used to refer to the mark later.
System.Boolean isPublic

Whether or not this legend mark can be seen by other players. By convention, private marks are prefixed with " - ".
System.Int32 quantity

Quantity of the legend mark. For instance "Mentored Dude (2)". Also by convention, quantity is expressed in parenthesis at the end of the mark.
System.Boolean displaySeason

Whether or not to display the season of a mark (e.g. Fall, Summer)
System.Boolean displayTimestamp

Whether or not to display the in-game time of a mark (e.g. Hybrasyl 5)
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean
| Improve this Doc View Source

AddLegendMark(LegendIcon, LegendColor, String, String, Boolean, Int32, Boolean, Boolean)

Add a legend mark with the specified icon, color, text, and prefix to a player's legend, which will default to being issued now (current in-game time).

Declaration
public bool AddLegendMark(LegendIcon icon, LegendColor color, string text, string prefix = null, bool isPublic = true, int quantity = 0, bool displaySeason = true, bool displayTimestamp = true)
Parameters
Type Name Description
LegendIcon icon

The icon to be used for the mark (heart, sword, etc)
LegendColor color

The color the mark will be rendered in (blue, yellow, orange, etc)
System.String text

The actual text of the legend mark.
System.String prefix

An invisible key (stored in the beginning of the mark) that can be used to refer to the mark later.
System.Boolean isPublic

Whether or not this legend mark can be seen by other players. By convention, private marks are prefixed with " - ".
System.Int32 quantity

Quantity of the legend mark. For instance "Mentored Dude (2)". Also by convention, quantity is expressed in parenthesis at the end of the mark.
System.Boolean displaySeason

Whether or not to display the season of a mark (e.g. Fall, Summer)
System.Boolean displayTimestamp

Whether or not to display the in-game time of a mark (e.g. Hybrasyl 5)
Returns
Type Description

SetCookie(String, Object)

Set a cookie. A cookie is a key-value pair with a dynamic value (of any type) associated to a given name (a string key). NPCs and other scripting functionality can use this to store independent state to track quest progress / etc. Cookies set by SetCookie are permanent.

Declaration
public void SetCookie(string cookieName, dynamic value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String cookieName

Name of the cookie
System.Object value

Dynamic (any type) value to be stored with the given name.
| Improve this Doc View Source

SetSessionCookie(String, Object)

Set a session cookie. A cookie is a key-value pair with a dynamic value (of any type) associated to a given name (a string key). NPCs and other scripting functionality can use this to store independent state to track quest progress / etc. Session cookies are deleted when a player is logged out.

Declaration
public void SetSessionCookie(string cookieName, dynamic value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String cookieName

Name of the cookie
System.Object value

Dynamic (any type) value to be stored with the given name.
| Improve this Doc View Source
